comment: 4 week summer course consisted of 15 quizzes, a midterm, a final, and 2 discussion posts. Instead of actually grading the discussion posts, he rounded down from the midterm and final grades (got a 92 on the midterm and 90 on discussion 1; 76 on final and 75 on discussion 2). His intro video is from 2018 and does not align with the syllabus quiz
Mid semester decided to switch all quizzes to lockdown browser. Not helpful, lectures are super long but doesn't contribute to my understanding of the topic.
Every quiz is lockdown browser and webcam, very tough grader on module discussions, must get textbook or you're doomed. stay away
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Replies very rudely (usually) even if you respectfully ask for advice or help. Uses lockdown w/ camera for quizzes & tests, uses confusing wording, no extra credit, grammar fanatic, & doesn't accept late work (he does not care if it is an emergency or any excuse). If you have no other option and get stuck having to take him like me then good luck!!

Worse Professor I've had at KSU. He doesn't care about you at all. I had him for two classes and he told me that I needed to drop his class after telling him that I missed one assignment because his due date was at 4 pm instead of 11:59 pm. dropped his first class and failed his second class and would never take it again.
I would not recommend this class unless you want to teach yourself and question your self-worth everyday. Everything is lockdown browser and webcam. Do not expect useful feedback or help.

DO NOT take this professor. Your grade will only consist of three exams, in which he will give you no sort of saying what is on it. No PowerPoints, no lectures, no assignments, just random topics are spoken about. It was a waste of my time and money. If you take this class, you are going to have to teach yourself. Save yourself the stress.

Intentionally makes exams extremely difficult and then curves the grade at the end of the semester. No study guides, lectures aren't really helpful for exams.

However, professor really cares about his class and obviously enjoys teaching his subject.

He is a cool person and he likes to talk and crack jokes, which honestly isn't terrible. There are no PowerPoints and he says, "Pay attention to what we are talking about because it might be on your test." Attendance isn't mandatory but if you don't go and pay attention then you WILL FAIL. READ THE TEXTBOOK!!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: He was by far the worst professor I have ever taken. I had As on everything in his class but the exams which he does not provide study guides or specific chapter to study for. When I asked for help he responded to me halfway through the semester and told me to get a tutor. I ended up not being able to pass his class since he was of no help

The best teacher at Kennesaw by far!! He is soooo amazing and extremely helpful. His lectures are amazing and extremely easy to follow!!! His tests are easy and he will let you use open notes on 3 out of 5 tests! EASY A+!

Ok so here's the thing, prof stringer is a really nice guy and likes to joke around in class however he is not the best at posting things to d2l and making deadlines and assignments clear. so if u don't go to class u will prob not do well. I also don't really get how his grading does not match his laid back attitude in class. he grades HARD!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Tough grader

comment: I had Stringer before and it was completely awful, however, this class was pretty easy and simple. He went easy on us due to it being a summer course and I think he desperately wanted this class to be a future class -- officially. It's a special topics class. 2 exams on lockdown, but quizzes weren't on lockdown. It was SUPER easy, I was surprised.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Stringer isn't thorough in lectures, so I read the textbook, used the student study website, and made quizlets to help succeed in his class. We had to complete a quiz and discussion board every week. He is VERY adamant about cheating not being tolerated in his class. Study for the tests! If you're a good writer, you'll ace the research paper.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: There is no textbook for this class, but honestly I would have preferred one. He assigns multiple journal articles a week to read and most of them were very lengthy and hard to keep up with while taking 4 other classes. The tests and weekly quizzes were lockdown and the questions asked for VERY specific. Made the class harder than it needed to be.

Assigns a LOT of reading, never posts full lectures, changed a big duedate with no notice, offers little help with content questions and technical issues (ironic), barely gave 100s on discussions. He took the joy out of learning & had us all wishing for the end of the class. I can tell he wants to be a good professor, but falls short by a lot

I would only take this class if this is the only class you plan to take the semester. Every week he assigns three readings that are at least 25 pages long in which the quizzes for each week ask questions about tiny, specific details. His tests are lockdown browser where he expects you to write essays with citations from readings. Save your grade!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Does not know how to grade essays correctly. Too harsh on grading.

I took him for summer class and his tests are 30+ questions, but 55+% of your grade on those tests is dependent on 3 essay questions, where you are expected to write 2 paragraphs and cite your sources, all while on a lockdown browser. In addition to harshly grading a final research paper at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Took him for a summer course. Need to read 125 pages of studies a week and memorize facts about them. All quizzes are tests are locked down AND he expects you to cite your sources from memory when doing open ended portions. Inconsistent ramblings on the lectures. Terrible prof, doesn't actually teach content. I'd rather get oc'd than take it again
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Taking this class for online summer class. He gives us 3 or 4 articles to read that are 27 pages long (every single of them). 1 quiz per module, his lectures don't make sense since he babbles in the background. His class is more of a memorization than learning. I won't remember a single thing I learned from his class. Please don't take him online.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: All you have to do is show up consistently and talk to him. If you can manage that you'll do fine. His tests are kinda annoying, but just study the textbook as much as you can. I got Cs on the tests but an A in the class because I got perfect scores on the paper and participation. Second time taking him and would take a third if I could.

Stringer is very animated about what he teaches. This is my second time taking him because I really enjoyed him the first time. The material is very difficult but he will go over things we don't understand and gives very good feedback.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Prof Stringer is a babe. He gave the entire class five extra points on our final grades. Some complain about taking his online summer term research methods class, which of course was not a good time.

Dr. Stringer is cool. He gets off topic a lot but that does not make him a horrible professor. Make sure you get the book and come to class because a lot of what you hear in class and read out the the textbook will be on your test.

TERRIBLE. Had this class online over the summer. Research methods. He is a tough and inconsistent grader. Over half of the class dropped the course which pushed back graduation for them. I was barley able to stay in. He posted the midterm grade after add drop without academic penalty, so it messed up gpa for those that had to drop. DO NOT TAKE!!

One of the worst teachers at KSU and that is not an exgatteration. We barely get any work done becase he constantly talks even when we are doing powerpoints that we must present. He will spend half of class talking about irrelevant information and when the class fails he think its funny and jokes about it. If an administartor saw him he'd be fired.

DO NOT TAKE RESEARCH METHODS ONLINE! IF you dont want to graduate on time then go for it. Professor doesn't have office hours and is NOT helpful whatsoever. By far the worse professor I've ever had at KSU. Syllabus does NOT match course. Posted midterm grade after add drop. GRADES were not consistent one week you fail next week you fail.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Tries too hard to get laughs out the class, can be annoying. Reviews before test, Really wants people to laugh at his jokes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Very easy teacher , no book required my only advice is to start the research paper right after midterm I waited to last day and still managed to pull out a 76, Very easy class just remember to do the discussion post and reply.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Stringer is by far one of the best professors Ive ever had. Hes very intelligent about the subject and his lectures are very entertaining. He loves to share his experiences that pertain to class. His tests arent hard as long as you study prior and attend his review lecture. He cares about his students success and will help when needed.
